intro: Scleria tepuiensis, commonly known as the tepui scleria, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. Scleria tepuiensis is noted for its ornamental value and is often found in specialized botanical collections due to its rarity and unique habitat.
